body:
this seems to be the field. 

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/4e66327bf46f5cb69b51094fd2e61c32dc7a69f2/extensions/vertx-http/runtime/src/main/java/io/quarkus/vertx/http/runtime/AccessLogConfig.java#L45

where to find the implementation? @geoand 

adding workaround on caller method seems not to be sustainable:

https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/blob/4e66327bf46f5cb69b51094fd2e61c32dc7a69f2/extensions/vertx-http/runtime/src/main/java/io/quarkus/vertx/http/runtime/VertxHttpRecorder.java#L498
~~Why would you not make the base name be `access.`?~~ Oh I see, the other parts of the config prepend a dot, but not this one.

I did try using `access.` as base name and that made the original log file named `access..log`, even though the rotated file name is indeed `access.2025-01-31.log` but I think `access..log` is more miserable ðŸ˜¢

issue.title: Fix divider in rotated access log for `DefaultAccessLogReceiver`

issue.title: Issue #48342 chore: simplify `DefaultAccessLogReceiver`
issue.body: [#48342] chore: resolve obsoletes in `DefaultAccessLogReceiver` - https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/48398 Unused declaration:

body:
### **Issue Summary and Feedback**  
Submitted a fix, but the issue was closed as unresolvable without first addressing significant technical debt. The affected class contains **far more than 50% dead or incorrect code**.  

Relevant links:  
- https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/discussions/48471  
- https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/48398
- https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/pull/48449

### **Migration Consideration: Spring**  
Given Quarkus's current limitations, migrating to **Spring** may be worthwhile, as it benefits from **a decade more maturity**â€”especially in security.  

### **Security Comparison**  
Spring has a **dedicated security subproject** with extensive documentation, while Quarkus offers only **a single guide**â€”suggesting a disparity in prioritization.  

### **Production Challenges**  
We faced these shortcomings directly during our Quarkus deployment:  
- **Lack of `javax.security` support** caused critical issues, with no timely resolution (https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/28995).  
- As a workaround, we **replaced all Panache repositories** with manual boilerplate due to delayed security patches.  
- Reference: https://quarkus.io/guides/security-architecture

@Pankraz76  you are pointing to https://github.com/quarkusio/quarkus/issues/28995 which shows issues reported Nov 2,2022 -  where you report a security issue in public github rather than using the documented way of opening security issues - it is fixed the *same* day - was backported Nov 3, 2022.

 Since that time the Quarkus Security guides greatly expanded - your link to security-architecture guide has tons of information linked of it.

Here is a screenshot to call it out explicitly:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/59e52bac-adbf-4868-be27-ec3ec0a90333)

Similar if you go to our main guide page and look in security catagory: https://quarkus.io/guides/#categories=security

You'll find lots of info:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/7673f4ec-5ce2-4b3e-9179-de3a45310584)

If you are trying to make a point that we are not taking security seriously, you are really failing hard at it.

it was not released with next patch or hotfix, which i expected for security, but with next bigger version, meaning major or feature, idk, which took longer then the regular 3 weeks cycle back then.

This was the reason, we did not rely on (quarkus) release but fix it ourself, reimplementing the panache auto generated endpoints.

Assuming Closed on: `Dec 19, 2022, 5:04 PM GMT+1` took only 6 weeks to release security. **Fix in repo does not matter, need fix on server in production.** Dont want to hate, quarkus and the community giving their **very best**. Very dedicated as well. Its simply never enough.

@Pankraz76 it was released in main snapshots that night. Available in 2.14.1 release Nov 16. 

We *also* backported it in 2.13 when we felt it been tested and could be backported in a timely manner. 

We backported as things came in as fast as we could. 

All for free. 

Since that time we set up LTS releases because feedback from users and customers was that a more regular cadence should happen. 

That is in place now in Quarkus 3 stream. 

Please stop spreading FUD.
was not aware about that, thanks for update.

sorry for flaming and breakout.

Lets fix, as its almost just 1 LOC.

issue.title: Make sure files generated by DefaultAccessLogReceiver are consistent
